That is a once in life time memory. In 1990, when I returned from the Gulf War, I was tasked with my Division's equipment recovery at Houston Port. On an off day I visited Johnson Space Center in uniform. The NASA people opened the center to me giving me a personal tour. I got to see the ISS mock up before it was built. Can never say enough about their hospitality. Giving an Infantry Captain the chance to see their facilities.
Wow... Dude... What an opportunity! I wish I'd have known you were in state. I'd have driven down from Dallas to meet ya.
